note.p: Death: At his residence, 6 Brookside, Cambridge (01 March 1884)
Education: University College, London. BA (1842), MA (London). St John's College, Cambridge. BA (1848, Senior Wrangler and 1st Smith's Prizeman)

Career: Assistant Master at a school in Peckham; Fellow, St John's College, Cambridge (1848); published books on mathematics; Principal Mathematical Lecturer, St John's College, Cambridge. and Mathematical Examiner to the Council of Military Education; died of paralysis
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1884 vol 37 pp xxvii-xxxii signed by E J R
References: Alex D D Craik, 'James Ivory's last papers on the 'Figure of the Earth' (with biographical additions) in NR 2002 vol 56 pp 187-204
Notes: W Hopkins has signed election certificate twice
